DataElement.preferredName: Difficulty Running And/Or Hyperreflexia Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score Assessment Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the difficulty running or hyperreflexia neurologic function scale domain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Difficulty Running And/Or Hyperreflexia Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved._The act of traveling on foot at a fast pace._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Autonomic nervous system overreaction to stimuli, most commonly after spinal cord injury at a T-5 level and above._A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
The act of traveling on foot at a fast pace.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Autonomic nervous system overreaction to stimuli, most commonly after spinal cord injury at a T-5 level and above.
A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Neurologic Function Scale Assessment Score Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A 25-point scale used to evaluate the severity of gross neurologic dysfunction by scoring 15 disabilities across multiple domains._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
